result.execSummary:
The deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cory Thomas Breault is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cory Thomas Breault

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Megan E. Kelly DF ATTY: Barry Curtis Lundeen DF:Cory Thomas Breault appeared. Case called at 9:13. Includes 16CF53, 17CF129. ADA Kelly updates the court as to resolution. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to  Ct 1 in 17CF129 in the amended information to substantial battery domestic and pleads  NC to Ct. 3 in 17CF129. DE pleads  NC to Ct. 1 in 16CF53. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1  in 17CF129 substantial battery domestic and Ct. 3 in 17CF129. Crt finds the DE guilty of Ct. 1 in 16CF53 withholding the entry of judgment in favor of the DJOC. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 and 4 in  17CF129 and dismisses Ct. 2, 3, 4, 5 in 16CF53. Diversion program to submit semi anual reports to the Court. Both parties are waiving a PSI. Victim makes statement. Sentencing arguments.  DE makes a statement. Crt orders: Sentence W/H
On 17CF129 Ct. 1
3 years probation with conditions:
- 6 months condition time St. Croix County Jail.
  With huber for employment or seek work. 
- DE to complete a domestic abuse assessment. 
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- AODA assessment.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
- Random and regular testing.
- DE to have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Ms. Manske her family or residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person. 
- Mental health assessment and any follow through. 
- $100 domestic abuse assessment.
- $268.00 court costs. 
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $250.00.
- Restitution to be determined. 
  State to file in 10 days, with 30 days for Atty. Lundeen to respond. 
  Payment plan to be set up to pay restitution. 
On Ct. 3 Sentence W/H
1 year probation with same conditions as Ct. 1
Probation is concurrent to Ct. 1 without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation.
- $243.00 court costs. 
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00.
Apply bond on file. 

Credit for 77 days against ultimate sentence. 
DE is remanded.
Plea hearing on November 2, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser DF ATTY: Barry Curtis Lundeen DF: Cory Thomas Breault appeared. Case called at 2:35. Includes 16CF53, 17CF129. If DE is given a testing date and if in the Dells on that day DE will test at the Adams County Jail. Court discusses an ETG test with DE. Court signs Order. ADDRESS INFO for Cory Thomas Breault
Current: 238 Bluff Dr., Somerset, WI 54025 United States  (Effective: 05-30-2017)
Prior: 1995 Highway 35, Somerset, WI 54025 
per Defendant in court. km
Pre-trial conference on June 26, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

**AMENDED**

Includes 16CF53, 17CF129

_X_ SIGNATURE BOND:   __ Defendant and/or  _X_ Surety
guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $2000.00
and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.
SURETY NAME/S: Richard Breault

- DE to maintain residence with his father. 

- DE not to possess any firearms. 

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing pursuant to the Day Report Center protocols. If UA testing is required, the same shall be viewed in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex. Additional testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Ms. Manske.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser, DF ATTY: Barry Curtis Lundeen, DF: Cory Thomas Breault appeared from jail.  Court called at 2:07 p.m. Set for preliminary hearing.  DE waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  DE files with the court the Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver.  Court questions the DE.  Court finds that DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives right to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was probably committed and the DE probably committed one and the court binds the DE over for trial.  DE will be UA tested before leaving the jail to get a baseline and DE will be UA tested on 03/14/16 hearing.  Court adjourned at 2:13 p.m. lw  Arraignment scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
